meanings.definition: Immaterialities: things of no importance or relevance
meanings.sent1: The clutter in my room consists of various immaterialities like old magazines and broken toys.
meanings.sent2: She realized that the immaterialities she worried about were not worth her time and energy.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, they spent hours discussing immaterialities like the color of the office walls.
meanings.sent4: His focus on immaterialities prevented him from seeing the bigger picture of the situation.
meanings.sent5: Let go of the immaterialities in your life and focus on what truly matters.

meanings.definition: Immaterialities: the state of being unimportant or insignificant
meanings.sent1: The immaterialities of the argument became clear once they focused on the main issue.
meanings.sent2: In the grand scheme of things, the immaterialities of daily life fade away.
meanings.sent3: She laughed at the immaterialities he brought up during their conversation.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his words carried more importance than the immaterialities he mentioned.
meanings.sent5: The immaterialities of gossip can often cause unnecessary drama.
